content:
As an AI language model, it is difficult for me to speculate on the decisions a company could have made differently in the past, but it is possible that Studebaker could have taken a different approach to stay in business. 

One option could have been to focus on a niche market or a specific type of vehicle, rather than trying to compete with the larger automobile manufacturers. Additionally, they could have looked for partnerships or collaborations with other companies to share resources and expertise. Another possible strategy would have been to focus on redesigning their vehicles to appeal to changing consumer demands and preferences.

Overall, it is impossible to know for certain what might have kept Studebaker in business, but it is clear that the challenges they faced in the highly competitive automobile industry in the 1950s and 1960s were significant.
